column4: Does anyone have any idea why I would be able to see all the wireless networks around me, but not be able to connect? I used ndiswrapper to install the drivers for my card. It claims it is supported. When I look at ndiswrapper -l the device and driver seem to be recognized.
I'm in the same situation
what card do you have?
which encryption method are you using? I tried WPA (with wpa_supplicant) and WEP, and nothing works. It works in my old install of Feisty and Debian.
it's a netgear card. Don't recall the exact model number
some people say their wifi is working with this app: http://wicd.sourceforge.net/download.php
I'll try it out myself in a bit.
I'll try it as well
I can't find any place to download it
I found the solution
false alarm. I was pinging myself >.>
not false alarm. It still was the true solution :P
Haha. Look how fast my internet is!
disable wpa_supplicant.
What did you do?
I removed wpa_supplicant from the system. (I'm trying to connect using WEP, since WPA1 was failing to connect for some reason)
How do I do that?
apt-get remove wpa_supplicant should do the trick.
I'll be right back once I get xchat set up in my desktop
Well, good luck Jedi. I can't get mine to work, and Ubuntu is doing strange things.
oi... I hope for the best.
The best seems to be Vista in this case, because Ubuntu is turning out to be what I thought it would. I can't even get the internet to work. :P
